title: Project-Based Learning Unit Modeling: Application of Educational Modeling Language (EML)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of core social studies theories and experience with project-based learning
context.additional_context: Social studies re-education program for professionals in their 30s, operated in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment with project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can understand the core components of Perspective-oriented EML (PoEML) and apply them to learning unit modeling.
Learners can optimize social studies project-based learning design by separating diverse perspectives (expressiveness, reusability, adaptability, etc.).
Learners can implement and share learning unit models using smartphone-based tools in limited technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
